lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is devoting $150 million in stimulus money for programs that help homeowners install solar panels and other energy improvements, which they pay for over time on their property tax bills, Todd Woody reports in The New York Times.
snippet: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac may not accept home loans if consumers take advantage of energy-efficiency programs.
abstract: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac may not accept home loans if consumers take advantage of energy-efficiency programs.
